intro: Bupleurum gracile var. rollii, commonly known as the slender bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its small, blue or purple flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
